content:
Seeking to challenge traditional notions of shoe design, "Stepping Into the Limelight" is an experimental fashion exhibition that runs until Sept. 29, 2013.
 
The exhibit features a wealth of styles by international designers with inspirations drawn from architecture, comic irony and social issues. Here's just a small sampling of the myriad of outlandish designs on display:
 

Photo: Joern Haufe/Getty Images

 
'Ohne Titel' shoes, by Svenja Ritter
 

* * * 
 

Photo: Joern Haufe/Getty Images

 
'Tongari Atama' shoes, by Gert van Gastel
 

* * * 
 

Photo: Joern Haufe/Getty Images

 
'Marie Antoinette' and 'Mina Harker' shoes, by Barbara Zucchi
 

* * * 
 

Photo: Joern Haufe/Getty Images

 
'Pink Poodle' shoes, by Jeremy Scott/Adidas
 

* * * 
 

Photo: Joern Haufe/Getty Images

 
'Mojito' shoes, by Julian Hakes
 

* * * 
 

Photo: Joern Haufe/Getty Images

 
'Loulou' shoes, by Pinelopi Loizidou
 

* * * 
 

Photo: Joern Haufe/Getty Images

 
'Flashes' shoes, by Jochen Kronier
 

* * * 
 

Photo: Joern Haufe/Getty Images

 
'Cutlery' by Lauren Johnstone, 'Shoebag' by Astrid Jansen, and 'Brooms' shoes by Sol Alonso

title: Museum showcases off-the-wall shoes [Photos]
